Package org.neo4j.io.fs

Interface StoreChannel

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, ByteChannel, Channel, Closeable, Flushable, GatheringByteChannel, InterruptibleChannel, ReadableByteChannel, ScatteringByteChannel, SeekableByteChannel, WritableByteChannel
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    LogVersionedStoreChannel
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdversarialFileChannel, DelegatingStoreChannel, LimitedFileChannel, PhysicalLogVersionedStoreChannel, StoreFileChannel, TransactionLogFile.UncloseableChannel
    public interface StoreChannel
extends Flushable, SeekableByteChannel, GatheringByteChannel, ScatteringByteChannel, InterruptibleChannel

    • Method Detail

      • tryLock

        FileLock tryLock()
          throws IOException
        Attempts to acquire an exclusive lock on this channel's file.
        Returns:
        A lock object representing the newly-acquired lock, or null if the lock could not be acquired.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
        ClosedChannelException - if the channel is closed.

      • writeAll

        void writeAll​(ByteBuffer src,
              long position)
       throws IOException
        Same as #write(), except this method will write the full contents of the buffer in chunks if the OS fails to write it all at once.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • writeAll

        void writeAll​(ByteBuffer src)
       throws IOException
        Same as #write(), except this method will write the full contents of the buffer in chunks if the OS fails to write it all at once.
        Throws:
        IOException

         long position)
  throws IOException
        Throws:

        See Also:
        FileChannel.read(java.nio.ByteBuffer, long)

      • readAll

        void readAll​(ByteBuffer dst)
      throws IOException
        Try to Read a sequence of bytes from channel into the given buffer, till the buffer will be full. In case if end of channel will be reached during reading IllegalStateException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        dst - destination buffer.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        IllegalStateException - if end of stream reached during reading.
        See Also:
        ReadableByteChannel.read(ByteBuffer)

    throws IOException

      • getFileDescriptor

        int getFileDescriptor()
        Get the OS file descriptor for this channel.
        Returns:
        the file descriptor.

      • hasPositionLock

        boolean hasPositionLock()
        Returns true if getPositionLock() returns a valid position lock object.
        Returns:
        true if this channel has a valid position lock.

      • getPositionLock

        Object getPositionLock()
        Return the position lock object for this channel, if any. This method only returns something meaningful if hasPositionLock() returns true. The position lock object works by synchronizing on the object. The file position is guaranteed to not be concurrently modified by other threads in the critical section.
        Returns:
        The position lock object, if any.

      • tryMakeUninterruptible

        void tryMakeUninterruptible()
        Make this channel uninterruptible, if possible. An uninterruptible channel will not automatically close itself if a calling thread is interrupted before or during an IO operation.
